item.title: Battlefield REDSEC now available for PS5, Xbox Series, and PC
item.content:encoded:
About

Battlefield REDSEC is a genre shifting free-to-play destination built on Battlefield‘s iconic DNA, featuring a bold new take on the Battle Royale genre, an intense squad-based competitive mode called Gauntlet and new ways to unlock the power of Portal. Battlefield REDSEC launches alongside Season 1 for Battlefield 6,which brings the battle to Southern California, introducing new seasonal content to the ultimate all-out warfare experience.

Today players can join the fight for free, with the launch of Battlefield REDSEC, an explosive sandbox set in the backyards and beaches of California in a destructible environment called Fort Lyndon.

As part of this free-to-play package, players can jump into Battlefield‘s biggest map ever Fort Lyndon, and experience an explosive new take on the Battle Royale genre. Battlefield‘s DNA is fused with the best of the Battle Royale genre, creating unrivaled opportunities for your team to approach each match and achieve ultimate victory. Players drop into a massive battle with 100 players, explore a massive world for powerful loot, and take down enemy squads through Battlefield‘s signature gameplay experience. The power of Tactical Destruction brings an entirely new level of strategy to the genre, as players create their own paths to victory or turn the environment into their own deadly weapon while crushing opposing squads. Each round is a bombastic ride on an incredible cinematic scale that Battlefield is known for.

Battlefield REDSEC‘s free-to-play destination also includes Gauntlet, a new mode which pushes squad competition to a new level of intensity. In this fast-paced elimination mode, eight teams of four-player squads compete in a series of dynamic round-based missions in a tournament-style format. Each round consists of 5-minute windows for squads to complete their mission objectives. Prepare for the unexpected as each round, location, and mission will be unique variables.

Players can also go beyond the lines in Battlefield REDSEC and change the rules of engagement with Battlefield Portal. With this toolset, players can create or discover their own Battlefield REDSEC experiences on the diverse and ever evolving Fort Lyndon playspace. Create a grueling battle environment with sledgehammers only, fight against the best of the best in a headshot contest or create something truly unexpected, with these powerful scripting and customization tools, all available within the Fort Lyndon sandbox for free.

Season 1

Starting today across all platforms, Season 1 will offer three distinct phases of content up through the holiday season. Season 1’s first phase called “Rogue Operations” launches today and features three new weapons, a new map, a new close quarters and high intensity multiplayer mode called Strikepoint, and much more. The new map Blackwell Fields is the latest large-scale all-out-war experience, set in the arid shrublands of Southern California, while the new mode Strikepoint brings Battlefield REDSEC‘s high stakes gameplay into multiplayer with its squad-focus, one-life experience in four-versus-four combat. The mode pits small teams against each other in fast rounds, battling over a single capture point.

Season 1 also sees the release of “Rogue Operations” themed Battle Pass with 100 tiers, six total paths and 10 prestige tiers. A premium BF Pro tier and premium store content is also available today.

Two more Season 1 content releases follow this year, with California Resistance launching on November 18 and Winter Offensive launching on December 9. California Resistance includes a new map set in the suburbs of Southern California and a new mode called Sabotage where players must destroy as many sites as possible before the round ends. While Winter Offensive includes special seasonal themed content.

Seasonal content will be released on a consistent basis, adding maps, modes, weapons, and more. All gameplay-impacting features will be free or earnable as part of our commitment to fair play and access for all players. As done with Battlefield Labs, Battlefield Studios will continue to build both Battlefield 6 and Battlefield REDSEC with players, taking their invaluable feedback into account as these games grow and the Battlefield universe expands.

item.title: Calamity Angels: Special Delivery launches February 17, 2026 in the west
item.content:encoded:
• PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch

Available in standard and Plus editions.

Delivery service RPG Calamity Angels: Special Delivery will launch for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and Switch on February 17, 2026 in the west, publisher Idea Factory International announced.

In Japan, Calamity Angels: Special Delivery launched for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and Switch on June 26.

The game will be available in standard and “Plus” editions. The Plus Edition, priced at $54.99 / £49.99 / €54.99, includes a physical copy of the game, 52-page hardcover art book, set of postcards, slipcase to hold the art book and postcard set, reversible cover sleeve, and an exclusive trading card.

Here is an overview of the game, via Idea Factory International:

About

Lead a rag-tag group of kooky carriers in this delivery service RPG as they protect and trek packages through treacherous terrains, unruly monsters, and meet other sneaky delivery service teams ready to stake their claim as the best delivery service in the Orkotris Region!

A new adventure awaits with every package!

Key Features

  • In the Mood for Battle? – Running a tip-top delivery service means mailing out orders AND keeping your crew in check. Watch their moods—if they’re unhappy, they might ignore your commands, but their negligence could deliver positive surprises and even victories in battle!
  • Out for Delivery! – Head to the Bulletin Board and see what deliveries await! Inspect the parcel, pack it tightly (no gaps allowed!), and assemble your crew with the right gear (to bonk any pesky foes) and tools for a smooth drop-off. Each successful drop-off delivers sweet rewards your way, so handle with care!
  • Delivery in Three-to-Five Business Days (Unless you Run into a Boss) – Start your adventure with a roulette spin to determine your next move. Land on shop spaces for goodies, collect special packages for rewards, and maybe tackle some sneaky bosses along the way!
  • Kei Nanameda… Delivers! – From the character designer of Mary Skelter and Death end re;Quest, Kei Nanameda presents a fresh delivery service world with lively dialogue, intense battles, and a quirky cast full of energy!

The System and Sound pages on the official English website were also updated with additional information today.

View images of the Plus Edition at the gallery.

item.title: Dungeon Stalkers for PC now available
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Version 1.0 launched after 2.5 months of Early Access.

Free-to-play player-versus-environment-versus-player dungeon crawler Dungeon Stalkers has left Early Access and is now available for PC via Steam, developer ONEUNIVERSE announced.

Dungeon Stalkers first launched in Early Access on August 13. A PlayStation 5 version is also in development.

“We have polished the game and added necessary core features with many updates during Early Access to create a fun, light extraction dungeon crawler,” said director Sejun Go in a press release. “These improvements, combined with the addition of new Stalkers and a brand-new map, will make Season 1 the most engaging and enjoyable experience that players have been waiting for.”

Here are the latest details:

During Early Access, Dungeon Stalkers underwent a rapid pace of updates based on community feedback. The team introduced new enemies, raid bosses, legendary gear, and additional dungeons, while also improving balance, killcam, solo ranking, controller support, reconnect functionality, and many other features. These updates culminate in the full 1.0 release, which officially kicks off a new season today.

What’s New in 1.0

  • Stalker Kazimorde – A legendary officer of the Tania Kingdom and a warrior known as the “Flash Hawk.” Kazimorde is a melee warrior who wields twin blades with expertise, boasting overwhelming DPS through fast normal attacks and combo attacks. He continuously attacks enemies with an attack tempo 20-30% faster than other Stalkers.
  • Mansion of Desire Dungeon – The manor of a noble aristocratic family from Asion has been swallowed into a rift of curses, becoming the “Mansion of Desire.” Within this rift, the manor retains its antique and luxurious appearance, yet exudes an eerie atmosphere, offering a new exploration experience distinct from the existing “Prison Dungeon.”
  • Insurance System: Scavenger Contract – Introducing “Scavenger,” a new NPC designed to alleviate the burden of equipment loss in Competitive Mode. By paying a small amount of Gold and entering into a contract with the Scavenger before entering Competitive (Solo, Trio) mode, you can recover your equipment if you fail to escape the dungeon.
  • Profile Customization System – A profile system will be added, allowing you to customize your profile card. Your profile will display borders, banner images, icons, and titles. Each of these elements will be unlockable through gameplay or purchasable with currency.
  • Season Reputation Point Reward System – “Reputation Points” will be awarded based on the sum of all Stalkers levels players achieved during the Pre-season. Reputation Points can be used in an exclusive shop to purchase special items such as profile icons, banners, and Stalkers skins.
  • Quality of Life Improvements – An array of various quality-of-life improvements, balance adjustments, a wider array of Legendary items, event content, and client/server stability enhancements are currently being prepared.
  • Legendary Nave Season Skin / Twitch Drop Nave Skin
  • Stalker Black Maria (one month after launch) – A high-ranking Inquisitor known as “White Night,” Black Maria is a warrior character whose core playstyle revolves around charged (RMB) attacks with a two-handed greatsword. She delivers powerful single blows through skill combos that combine engagement abilities, sustain, and shock skills.
  • Raid Boss The Mimic Queen (one month after launch) – An exciting and grotesque challenge to conquer, Amelia, the mistress of the Mansion of Desire, could not escape the Witch’s Curse in the chaos of the dungeon that twisted her body, and she merged with the gigantic, ornate treasure chest she cherished most.

The game sets itself apart from others in the extraction genre by focusing on unique characters, their gameplay abilities, as well as their stories within the dungeon. There are 6 characters each with unique playstyles, movesets and gear types available immediately, with four unlockable with in-game currency and more to come as the game continues to release content to keep the gameplay fresh and exciting with each update.

Key Features

  • Armor Destruction System – As characters take damage, this is represented visually with degraded armor and can be seen by enemy players, adding tension and strategic depth on how and when to engage.
  • Dynamic Witch’s Curse System – The Witch’s Curse changes dungeon conditions multiple times per session. Each 5 minute phase can bestow buffs, debuffs, summon power monsters or change rules on at moment’s notice
  • Multiple Game Modes – Choose between a lighter, fun and casual player-versus-environment experience or hardcore competitive player-versus-environment-versus-player dungeon run modes to suit your style and do so with teammates or solo.
  • Play as Unique Stalkers – Select from a roster of vivid, story-driven characters with diverse abilities and discover the story behind why each of them has found themselves here and unfold the secrets to the dungeon itself!

item.title: Lorelei and the Laser Eyes and Sayonara Wild Hearts coming to Switch 2 in early 2026
item.content:encoded:
• Switch 2

iOS version of Sayonara Wild Hearts also set to return.

Publisher Annapurna Interactive and developer Simogo will release Nintendo Switch 2 Editions of puzzle mystery game Lorelei and the Laser Eyes and pop album game Sayonara Wild Hearts in early 2026, the companies announced.

The companies also announced plans to bring Sayonara Wild Hearts back to iOS following its departure from Apple Arcade in 2024. It will re-debut on the App Store as a paid app in 2026.

Sayonara Wild Hearts is currently available for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam.

Lorelei and the Laser Eyes is available for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC via Steam.

item.title: Simogo Legacy Collection announced for Switch 2, Switch, and PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • Switch
  • Switch 2

Due out on December 2 for $14.99.

Simogo has announced Simogo Legacy Collection, a compilation of the developer’s first seven games, available for the first time on consoles and PC. It will launch for Switch 2, Switch, and PC via Steam on December 2 for $14.99.

Here is an overview of the collection, via Simogo:

About

Simogo Legacy Collection is a compilation of Simogo’s first seven games, which will now be available for the first time on console and PC. From cute arcade novelties to innovative text-based thrillers and acclaimed fourth wall-breaking stories, Simogo Legacy Collection is an eclectic celebration of Simogo’s past, featuring faithful renditions of critically acclaimed games released on mobile platforms between 2010 and 2015.

The games included—Kosmo Spin, Bumpy Road, Beat Sneak Bandit, Year Walk (and the Year Walk Companion), DEVICE 6, The Sailor’s Dream, and SPL-T—have sold over 1.5 million copies and have won awards at the Independent Games Festival, Apple Design Awards, and been nominated at the BAFTA and Game Developers Choice Awards.

Additionally, Simogo Legacy Collection features bonus content with thoughtfully curated curios from Simogo’s wide-ranging history, including spin-off projects, music, image galleries, and playable prototypes, including:

  • Year Walk Bedtime Stories for Awful Children – E-book.
  • The Lighthouse Painting – Audio drama Podcast.
  • Music – Tracks from Simogo’s history, including previously unreleased tracks.
  • Images – Illustrations from Simogo’s archive.
  • Year Walk Prototype – Playable prototype.
  • Bumpy Road Prototype – Playable prototype.
  • Rollovski Prototype – Playable prototype.
  • The Sensational December Machine – Playable short story.
